availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harrison M. Hurt (Clinton County, Kentucky, captain (U.S.A.))

body.p: Clinton County, Kentucky, soldier. Son of Reuben Hurt and Anna Hurt. Resident in Wayne County, Kentuck,y in 1850. Student in Clinton County in 1860. Served in 32nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain from November 2, 1862, to April 15, 1863. Served in 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as captain and major from December 23, 1863, to January 10, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, p. 312A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clinton County, p. 599.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 360.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 305, 929.
Records of the Department of Veterans Affairs, 1773-2007, U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, Series Number T288.
Find A Grave, "Harrison M. Hurt (1840-1927)," Memorial #2692147, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/26929147 (accessed January 17, 2020).
